title: 107_hr547
content: COVERAGE OF HAIR PROSTHESES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH SCALP HAIR LOSS DUE TO ALOPECIA AREATA. Amendment to the Public Health Service Act requires group health plans to cover hair prostheses for individuals with alopecia areata. Group health plans and health insurance issuers must cover scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with alopecia areata, as certified by their physician. The coverage cannot have less favorable cost-sharing than other prosthesis coverage, with a minimum of 80% payment by the plan or issuer. The plan or issuer will pay 80% of the customary costs for scalp hair prosthesis. The term includes artificial substitutes for scalp hair. Group health plans must comply with notice requirements. Amendments include adding a new section to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act. "SEC. 714. REQUIREMENT FOR COVERAGE OF HAIR PROSTHESES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH SCALP HAIR LOSS DUE TO ALOPECIA AREATA." Coverage for scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with scalp hair loss due to alopecia areata is required by group health plans and health insurance issuers, with no less favorable cost-sharing than other prosthesis coverage. The attending physician must certify in writing the medical necessity for this treatment. Group health plans and health insurance issuers must cover 80 percent of the costs for scalp hair prostheses, including artificial substitutes for scalp hair. This requirement is considered a material modification in the plan's terms, with notice to be provided within 60 days of the first plan year it applies. Section 731(c) and Section 732(a) of the Act are amended to include references to sections 711 and 714. The table of contents in the Act is also updated to reflect these changes. "Section 714 requires coverage of hair prostheses for individuals with scalp hair loss due to alopecia areata. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code to reflect this requirement." "Section 9813 mandates coverage of hair prostheses for individuals with scalp hair loss from alopecia areata." A group health plan must cover scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with hair loss due to alopecia areata if deemed medically necessary by a physician. The coverage cannot have limits or cost-sharing provisions less favorable than other prosthesis coverage, except for a possible 80% payment of customary costs. The term 'scalp hair prosthesis' includes artificial substitutes for scalp hair. Section 4980D(d)(1) of the Code is amended to include sections 9811 and 9813. Part B of title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act is amended to add a new section after section 2752. Requirement for coverage of hair prostheses for individuals with scalp hair loss due to alopecia areata. The provisions of section 2707(a) apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market. Health insurance issuers must comply with notice requirements similar to group health plans. Section 2762(b)(2) is amended to include additional sections. Effective dates apply to group health plans and insurance coverage. The amendments made by subsection (a) apply to group health plans starting from January 1, 2002, while the amendments made by subsection (b) apply to individual health insurance coverage in the individual market. There is an exception for group health plans under collective bargaining agreements ratified before the enactment of the Act. The last collective bargaining agreements related to the plan terminate on January 1, 2002. Plan amendments made to conform to new requirements do not terminate the collective bargaining agreement. Secretaries of Labor, Treasury, and Health and Human Services coordinate administration through an interagency memorandum of understanding. The Secretaries of Labor, Treasury, and Health and Human Services coordinate regulations and policies to ensure consistent enforcement and avoid duplication of efforts.
